official-title.#text: To authorize health insurance issuers to continue to offer for sale current group health insurance coverage in satisfaction of the minimum essential health insurance coverage requirement, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 11, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: If you like your group health insurance plan, you can keep it

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (including any amendment made by such Act or by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ), a health insurance issuer that has in effect health insurance coverage in the group market on any date during 2013 may after such date offer such coverage for sale through December 31, 2018, in such market outside of an Exchange established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311
Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1321

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ). A group health plan shall not be treated as not complying with the requirements of such Act (or the amendments made by such Acts) insofar as it provides health benefits through health insurance coverage that is permitted under the previous sentence.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1501(b) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501/ss:b

text.#text: Health insurance coverage described in subsection (a) shall be treated as a grandfathered health plan for purposes of the amendment made by

header.#text: Treatment as grandfathered health plan in satisfaction of minimum essential coverage

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed as affecting the authority of States with respect to the regulation of health insurance coverage in the group market.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3522 EH: Employee Health Care Protection Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
